Package org.neo4j.kernel.availability

Interface AvailabilityGuard

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CompositeDatabaseAvailabilityGuard, DatabaseAvailabilityGuard
    public interface AvailabilityGuard
    The availability guard ensures that the database will only take calls when it is in an ok state. It tracks a set of requirements (added via require(AvailabilityRequirement)) that must all be marked as fulfilled (using fulfill(AvailabilityRequirement)) before the database is considered available again. Consumers determine if it is ok to call the database using isAvailable(), or await availability using isAvailable(long).

    • Method Detail

      • require

        void require​(AvailabilityRequirement requirement)
        Indicate a requirement that must be fulfilled before the database is considered available.
        Parameters:
        requirement - the requirement object

      • fulfill

        void fulfill​(AvailabilityRequirement requirement)
        Indicate that a requirement has been fulfilled.
        Parameters:
        requirement - the requirement object

      • isAvailable

        boolean isAvailable()
        Check if the database is available for transactions to use.
        Returns:
        true if there are no requirements waiting to be fulfilled and the guard has not been shutdown

      • isShutdown

        boolean isShutdown()
        Check if the database has been shut down.

      • isAvailable

        boolean isAvailable​(long millis)
        Check if the database is available for transactions to use.
        Parameters:
        millis - to wait for availability
        Returns:
        true if there are no requirements waiting to be fulfilled and the guard has not been shutdown

      • await

        void await​(long millis)
    throws UnavailableException
        Await the database becoming available.
        Parameters:
        millis - to wait for availability
        Throws:
        UnavailableException - thrown when the timeout has been exceeded or the guard has been shutdown
